CSE100.name: Computer Science as a Profession
CSE100.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE100.description: The computing and programming profession. Professionalism and ethics. Industry practice. Experiments with programming.

CSE101.name: Computing Concepts and Competencies
CSE101.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSE101.description: Core concepts in computing including information storage, retrieval, management, and representation. Applications from specific disciplines. Applying core concepts to design and implement solutions to various focal problems, using hardware, multimedia software, communication and networks.

CSE102.name: Algorithmic Thinking and Programming
CSE102.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSE102.description: The fundamentals of computing, algorithms and programming, using a high-level language such as Python. Integrating programs with other applications.
CSE102.prerequisite: (MTH 103 or MTH 103B or MTH 116 or MTH 124 or MTH 132 or MTH 152H or LB 118) or designated score on Mathematics Placement test

CSE201.name: Fundamentals of Information Technology
CSE201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE201.description: Digital representation of objects such as numbers, signals, and 3-dimensional shapes. Algorithms that operate on digital objects. Computer communications and the Internet. Computer security and web services.
CSE201.prerequisite: (CSE 101 or CSE 131) and (MTH 103 or MTH 116 or MTH 124 or MTH 132 or MTH 152H or LB 118)

CSE220.name: Programming in C
CSE220.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE220.description: Basics of programming in C. Data types, operators, control, functions, arrays, pointers, file processing, testing and debugging.
CSE220.prerequisite: (EGR 100 or ECE 101) and ((MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently))

CSE231.name: Introduction to Programming I
CSE231.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSE231.description: Introduction to programming using Python. Design, implementation and testing of programs to solve problems such as those in engineering, mathematics and science. Programming fundamentals, functions, objects, and use of libraries of functions.
CSE231.prerequisite: (LB 118 or concurrently) or (MTH 124 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently)

CSE232.name: Introduction to Programming II
CSE232.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE232.description: Continuation of object-centered design and implementation in C++. Building programs from modules. Data abstraction and classes to implement abstract data types. Static and dynamic memory allocation. Data structure implementation and algorithm efficiency. Lists, tables, stacks, and queues. Templates and generic programming.
CSE232.prerequisite: (CSE 231 or CMSE 202) and (LB 118 or MTH 124 or MTH 132 or MTH 152H)

CSE260.name: Discrete Structures in Computer Science
CSE260.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE260.description: Propositional and first order logic. Equivalence and methods of proof. Basics of counting. Set operations, relations, functions. Grammars and finite state automata. Discrete probability. Applications to computer science and engineering.
CSE260.prerequisite: MTH 133 or MTH 126 or MTH 153H or LB 119

CSE290.name: Independent Study in Computer Science
CSE290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE290.description: Supervised individual study in an area of computer science.

CSE291.name: Selected Topics in Computer Science
CSE291.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE291.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses and lead to the development of new courses.

CSE320.name: Computer Organization and Architecture
CSE320.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE320.description: Boolean algebra and digital logic. Combinational and sequential circuits. Representations of data and instructions. Architecture and major components of computer systems. Assembly language programming and interfacing to high level languages. Assembler and linker processing.
CSE320.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor.

CSE325.name: Computer Systems
CSE325.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSE325.description: Process and processor management. Concurrent processes and threads. Memory management and the memory hierarchy. Networking and network protocols. Secure programming and communication methods.
CSE325.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE331.name: Algorithms and Data Structures
CSE331.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE331.description: Linear data structures, trees, graphs and algorithms which operate on them. Fundamental algorithms for searching, sorting, string matching, graph problems. Design and analysis of algorithms.
CSE331.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major and open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering.

CSE335.name: Object-oriented Software Design
CSE335.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE335.description: Development of large software products, libraries, and product families. Object-oriented programming using inheritance and polymorphism. Design methods. Specification and the use of contracts to design reliable software. Configuration management and life-cycle issues.
CSE335.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor.

CSE402.name: Biometrics and Pattern Recognition
CSE402.description: Automated techniques used for feature extraction and pattern matching focusing on face, fingerprint and iris recognition.
CSE402.prerequisite: (CSE 331) and (STT 351 or STT 380 or STT 430 or STT 441)
CSE402.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE404.name: Introduction to Machine Learning
CSE404.description: Core principles and techniques of all machine learning including model design and programming algorithms.
CSE404.prerequisite: (CSE 331) and (STT 351 or STT 380 or STT 430 or STT 441)
CSE404.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE410.name: Operating Systems
CSE410.description: Principles and evolution of operating systems. Process and processor management. Concurrent processes and threads. Primary and secondary storage management. Case studies of modern operating systems.
CSE410.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor.

CSE415.name: Introduction to Parallel Computing
CSE415.description: Core principles and techniques of parallel computing including architectures, programming models, and algorithm design. Performance analysis and optimization. Use of parallel computers.
CSE415.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE420.name: Computer Architecture
CSE420.description: Organization and architecture of computer systems. Arithmetic Logic Unit and control unit implementations. Hardwired and microprogrammed control. Pipelined processors; data and branch hazards. Memory hierarchy and storage devices. Input-output and peripheral devices. Advanced architectures.
CSE420.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor.

CSE422.name: Computer Networks
CSE422.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE422.description: Computer network architectures and models. Physical media and signaling. Data link protocols. Medium access control. Routing and IP. Transport services including TCP/UDP. Network applications. Local-area and wide-area networks.
CSE422.prerequisite: (STT 351 or ECE 280 or STT 430 or STT 441) and CSE 325
CSE422.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE425.name: Introduction to Computer Security
CSE425.description: Theory and practice of security engineering. Security protocols. Cryptography and cryptanalysis. Smartcards. Network security and intrusion detection. Common system attacks.
CSE425.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE429.name: Interdisciplinary Topics in CyberSecurity
CSE429.description: Technical, legal, criminal, medical business, and communication aspects of CyberSecurity.
CSE429.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

CSE431.name: Algorithm Engineering
CSE431.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE431.description: Algorithm analysis, design, implementation, and optimization for a broad range of problem categories including techniques to recognize and cope with intractable problems.
CSE431.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE435.name: Software Engineering
CSE435.description: Software lifecycle including specification, design, coding, testing, and verification of a software product. Stepwise refinement and traceability. Software maintenance and documentation.
CSE435.prerequisite: (CSE 331 and CSE 335) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
CSE435.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE440.name: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
CSE440.description: Fundamental issues in intelligent systems. Knowledge representation and mechanisms of reasoning. Search and constraint satisfaction. Agents. Application areas of AI and current topics.
CSE440.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE444.name: Information Technology Project Management
CSE444.description: Practical training and experiences in design, testing, and launch of new information technologies and systems.
CSE444.restrictions: Open to students in the Information Technology Minor.

CSE450.name: Translation of Programming Languages
CSE450.description: Theory and practice of programming language translation. Languages, grammars and parsing. Lexical, syntactic and semantic analysis. Compile-time error handling. Code optimization and code generation.
CSE450.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE460.name: Computability and Formal Language Theory
CSE460.description: Formal models of computation such as finite state automata, pushdown automata and Turing machines. Formal definitions of languages, problems, and language classes including recursive, recursively enumerable, regular, and context free languages. The relationships among various models of computation, language classes, and problems. Church's thesis and the limits of computability. Proofs of program properties including correctness.
CSE460.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor.

CSE471.name: Media Processing and Multimedia Computing
CSE471.description: Basic operations for processing images, video, and audio. Devices for input and output. Data formats and compression. Tools for processing images and sound. Multimedia authoring tools. Applications.
CSE471.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE472.name: Computer Graphics
CSE472.description: Graphics systems. Two- and three-dimensional imaging geometry and transformations. Curve and surface design. Rendering, shading, color, and animation. Graphics programming.
CSE472.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE476.name: Mobile Application Development
CSE476.description: Software development techniques for mobile devices such as smart phones and tablet computers.
CSE476.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE477.name: Web Application Architecture and Development
CSE477.description: Fundamentals of World Wide Web (WWW) programming, including protocols, client-server interaction, markup languages, client- and server-side programming, databases, and remote procedure calls. Development of a WWW server and WWW sites with browser-based interfaces to remote databases. Students will incorporate scaling, throughput, and latency considerations in the development of widely-distributed systems.
CSE477.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE480.name: Database Systems
CSE480.description: Storage of and access to physical databases including indexing, hashing, and range accesses. Relational data models, database design principles, query languages, query optimization, transaction processing and recovery techniques. Object-oriented and distributed databases.
CSE480.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE482.name: Big Data Analysis
CSE482.description: Data collection, storage, and preprocessing, and analysis techniques. Programming for large-scale data analysis. Case studies and applications.
CSE482.prerequisite: (CSE 331) and (STT 351 or STT 380 or STT 430 or STT 441)
CSE482.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CSE490.name: Independent Study in Computer Science
CSE490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE490.description: Supervised individual study in an area of computer science.
CSE490.restrictions: Open to students in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Computer Science Major. Approval of department; application required.

CSE491.name: Selected Topics in Computer Science
CSE491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE491.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses and lead to the development of new courses.
CSE491.restrictions: Open to students in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Computer Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor. Approval of department.

CSE492.name: Selected Topics in Data Science
CSE492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE492.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses in Data Science.

CSE495.name: Experiential Learning in Data Science (W)
CSE495.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE495.description: Team-based data science projects on realistic, large-scale data.
CSE495.prerequisite: (CSE 232 and CMSE 382) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

CSE498.name: Collaborative Design (W)
CSE498.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE498.description: Development of a comprehensive software and/or hardware solution to a problem in a team setting with emphasis on working with a client. Participation in a design cycle including specification, design, implementation, testing, maintenance, and documentation. Issues of professionalism, ethics, and communication.
CSE498.prerequisite: (CSE 402 or CSE 415 or CSE 422 or CSE 431 or CSE 440 or CSE 450 or CSE 471 or CSE 476 or CSE 477 or CSE 482) and (CSE 402 or CSE 420 or CSE 425 or CSE 435 or CSE 440 or CSE 460 or CSE 472 or CSE 477 or CSE 480 or CSE 482) and (CSE 335 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) and (CSE 325 or CSE 410)
CSE498.restrictions: Open to students in the Computer Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major.

CSE801.name: Introduction to Computational Science for Evolutionary Biologists
CSE801.description: Introductory and intermediate programming and scripting for data analysis and modeling. Algorithmic considerations. Scientific controls, workflows, and reproducibility.
CSE801.restrictions: Not open to graduate students in the College of Engineering or in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering. Approval of department.

CSE801A.name: Introduction to Big Data Analysis
CSE801A.description: Introduction to data retrieval, processing, analysis, and visualization.
CSE801A.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Business Analytics Major.

CSE801B.name: Introduction to Data Mining
CSE801B.description: Basic techniques and algorithms for knowledge discovery in databases.
CSE801B.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Business Analytics Major.

CSE802.name: Pattern Recognition and Analysis
CSE802.description: Algorithms for classifying and understanding data. Statistical and syntactic methods, supervised and unsupervised machine learning. Cluster analysis and ordination. Exploratory data analysis. Methodology for design of classifiers.
CSE802.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering.

CSE803.name: Computer Vision
CSE803.description: Visual information processing problems. Human and machine vision systems. Image formation and transforms. Encoding, enhancement, edge detection, segmentation. 2D and 3D object description and recognition. Scene analysis. Applications.
CSE803.restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors.

CSE812.name: Distributed Systems
CSE812.description: Principles, paradigms, techniques used in distributed systems. Assurance techniques for distributed systems. Fault-tolerance and security issues in distributed systems. Research issues in the design and implementation of distributed systems.
CSE812.restrictions: Open to students in the Electrical Engineering Major or in the Computer Science Major.

CSE813.name: Advanced VLSI Design
CSE813.description: Advanced topics in digital integrated circuit design. Design specifications

CSE820.name: Advanced Computer Architecture
CSE820.description: Advanced concepts in the organization and architecture of modern computer systems.
CSE820.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering.

CSE822.name: Parallel Computing
CSE822.description: Core principles, techniques, and use of parallel computation using modern supercomputers. Parallel architectures. Parallel programming models. Principles of parallel algorithm design. Performance analysis and optimization.

CSE824.name: Advanced Computer Networks and Communications
CSE824.description: Advanced topics in emerging computer networking technologies, including high-speed wide area networks and local area networks, wireless and mobile computing networks, optical networks, and multimedia networking.
CSE824.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.

CSE825.name: Computer and Network Security
CSE825.description: Threat assessments, secure software, intrusions and intrusion detection.

CSE830.name: Design and Theory of Algorithms
CSE830.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE830.description: Analysis of algorithms. Algorithm design techniques. Efficient algorithms for classical problems. Intractable problems and techniques to handle them.
CSE830.restrictions: Open only to majors in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.

CSE835.name: Algorithmic Graph Theory
CSE835.description: Classical concepts in Graph Theory. Algorithmic aspects of graphs such as finding paths, network flow, spanning trees and matching.
CSE835.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.

CSE836.name: Probabilistic Models and Algorithms in Computational Biology
CSE836.description: Canonical probabilistic models and algorithms used in important bioinformatics tools

CSE841.name: Artificial Intelligence
CSE841.description: Types of intelligence, knowledge representation, cognitive models. Goal-based systems, heuristic search and games, expert systems. Language understanding, robotics and computer vision, theorem proving and deductive systems, and learning.
CSE841.restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors.

CSE842.name: Natural Language Processing
CSE842.description: Models and algorithms for natural language processing including syntax, semantics, pragmatics, and discourse. Knowledge-based and statistical approaches to a variety of language related applications.

CSE843.name: Language and Interaction
CSE843.description: Introduction to foundations and the state-of-the-art technology enabling natural language communication with artificial agents. Speech recognition, acoustic modeling and language modeling, dialogue and discourse modeling, psycholinguistic studies on situated human language processing, and their applications in situated human robot dialogue.

CSE845.name: Multi-disciplinary Research Methods for the Study of Evolution
CSE845.description: Techniques for engaging in multi-disciplinary research collaborations, including biology, computer science, and engineering. Students engage in group projects to answer fundamental questions about the dynamics of actively evolving systems including both natural and computational. Multi-disciplinary teams will learn to overcome discipline-specific language and conceptual issues. Experimental design, statistical analysis, data visualization, and paper and grant writing for multi-disciplinary audiences.

CSE847.name: Machine Learning
CSE847.description: Computational study of learning and data mining. Strengths and limitations of various learning paradigms, including supervised learning, learning from scalar reward, unsupervised learning, and learning with domain knowledge.
CSE847.restrictions: Open only to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.

CSE848.name: Evolutionary Computation
CSE848.description: Investigation of evolutionary computation from a historical, theoretical and application viewpoint. Readings from the present literature, experiments with provided software on the application of evolutionary computation principles.
CSE848.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering and open to graduate students in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering or approval of department.

CSE860.name: Foundations of Computing
CSE860.restrictions: Open only to majors in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.

CSE867.name: Nature and Practice of Cognitive Science
CSE867.description: Survey of how different disciplines explore the cognitive processes underlying intelligent behavior.

CSE870.name: Advanced Software Engineering
CSE870.description: Methods and techniques supporting later lifecycle activities, including software testing and maintenance, reuse, and reverse engineering. Domain-specific software engineering methods. Human-computer interfaces, distributed systems, and visualization techniques.
CSE870.restrictions: Open only to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.

CSE872.name: Advanced Computer Graphics
CSE872.description: Advanced aspects of digital image generation, geometric modeling, computer animation and rendering methods.

CSE881.name: Data Mining
CSE881.description: Techniques and algorithms for knowledge discovery in databases, from data preprocessing and transformation to model validation and post-processing. Core concepts include association analysis, sequential pattern discovery, anomaly detection, predictive modeling, and cluster analysis. Application of data mining to various application domains.

CSE885.name: Artificial Neural Networks
CSE885.description: Overview of neuro-engineering technology. Basic neural network architectures. Feedforward and feedback networks. Temporal modeling. Supervised and unsupervised learning. Implementation. Basic applications to pattern recognition.

CSE890.name: Independent Study
CSE890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSE890.description: Independent study of some topic, system, or language not covered in a regular course.
CSE890.restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors. Approval of department.

CSE891.name: Selected Topics
CSE891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CSE891.description: Selected topics in computer science of current interest and importance but not covered in a regular course.
CSE891.restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors.

CSE898.name: Master's Project
CSE898.description: In depth student project where the student performs original research, research replication, or survey and reporting on a topic such as system design and development, or system conversion or installation.
CSE898.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering. Approval of department.

CSE899.name: Master's Thesis Research
CSE899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSE899.restrictions: Open only to Computer Science majors. Approval of department.

CSE902.name: Selected Topics in Recognition by Machine
CSE902.description: Advanced topics in pattern recognition and computer vision such as Markov random fields, modeling and recognition of three dimensional objects, and integration of visual modules.
CSE902.restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors.

CSE910.name: Selected Topics in Computer Networks and Distributed Systems
CSE910.description: Advanced topics and developments in high-bandwidth computer networks, protocol engineering, and distributed computer systems.
CSE910.restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors.

CSE914.name: Formal Methods in Software Development
CSE914.description: Current research in selected areas of software engineering such as
CSE914.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.

CSE920.name: Selected Topics in High Performance Computer Systems
CSE920.description: Design of high performance computer systems. Seminar format.
CSE920.restrictions: Open to students in the Computer Science Major or approval of department.

CSE941.name: Selected Topics in Artificial Intelligence
CSE941.description: Topic such as second generation expert systems, human factors, natural language processing, speech understanding, neural networks, genetic algorithms and opportunistic planning.
CSE941.restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors.

CSE960.name: Selected Topics in Algorithms and Complexity
CSE960.description: Current research in the general theory of algorithms and computational complexity.
CSE960.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering. Approval of department.

CSE980.name: Selected Topics in Database Systems
CSE980.description: Recent developments in areas such as distributed and parallel database systems, object oriented database systems, knowledgebase and expert database systems.
CSE980.restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors.

CSE999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
CSE999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CSE999.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Computer Science major. Approval of department.
